ru.itu.predictools

Class Predictor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.itu.predictools.Predictor

  • public class Predictor
extends java.lang.Object
    Predictor is a container class that includes methods for making and managing adaptive fuzzy predictive search through main language national corpus dictionary and user's words and phrases dictionaries.

    User's dictionaries could be changed by adding, removing and updating dictionaries' entries.

    Fuzzy search is made on the n-gram index and uses Levenstein distance metric to measure words similarity https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Levenshtein_distance

    Predictor class makes possible using several different groups of dictionaries of a variety of languages. There is no difference for the searching algorithm which language the dictionaries have if the dictionaries are the list of words composed from letters that could be organized into an alphabet

      • search

        public java.util.Set<ru.itu.predictools.registry.SearchDictionaryEntry> search(java.lang.String searchPattern,
                                                                               int maxDistance,
                                                                               ru.itu.predictools.metric.Metric metric,
                                                                               boolean prefix)
                                                                        throws java.io.IOException
        Makes search and returns result set of search
        Parameters:
        searchPattern - - String - pattern similar to the target of search
        maxDistance - - Integer - maximal allowable distance from searchPattern to a word from search dictionary calculated using selected metric
        metric - - LevensteinMetric object - metric to be used with this search
        prefix - - boolean - whether this search should be by prefix (if true) or by whole word
        Returns:
        Set\ - set of SearchDictionaryEntry objects similar to the searchPattern parameter string
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if path of the one of dictionaries is wrong or if one of the dictionaries files doesn't exist

      • arrangedSearchResult

        public java.util.List<ru.itu.predictools.registry.SearchDictionaryEntry> arrangedSearchResult(int limit,
                                                                                              float buoyancy,
                                                                                              boolean limitBeforeRearranging)
        The method returns a limited and rearranged list of search dictionary entries that were found with last search run. A rearrangement is an sorting by virtual IPM (VIPM) where VIPM equals to the result of a multiplication of local frequency (a count of uses from the user's dictionary) by the coefficient that equal to an IPM range multiplied to the given buoyancy factor and divided by the sum of all words counters from user's dictionary:

        VIPM = localFrequency * buoyancy * max of main dictionary frequency / Sum of all user's dictionaries frequencies

        Parameters:
        limit - - the length of a resulting list
        buoyancy - - the buoyancy factor, this should be a float value in a range from 0 to 1
        Returns:
        List\ list of arranged string where words and phrases from user's dictionaries are rearranged according to their buoyancy factor

      • addSpecialSymbolsSubset

        public void addSpecialSymbolsSubset(java.util.Set<java.lang.Character> symbols)
                             throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Adds a new symbols set to the map of special (non-alphabetic symbols) and sets next bit flag during adding process Can keep up to 2^31 sets of special symbols.
        Parameters:
        symbols - Set\ - set of non-alphabetic symbols to be saved in the Predictor object
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - If there is try to add 2^31+1th set to the collection

      • getSpecialSymbolsSet

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.Character> getSpecialSymbolsSet(java.lang.Integer bitField)
        Gets a combined set of special symbol characters according to passed bit-field
        Parameters:
        bitField - - a bit-field descriptor of resulting special symbols set
        Returns:
        Set\ - a combined set of special symbol characters according to passed bit-field
